title: Sonargaon Day Tour from Dhaka
description: Take a private full-day tour of Sonargaon to get to know the cityâ€™s incredible historic administrative, commercial and maritime center in Bengal. The popular 8-hour tour includes all transportation, the services of a personal driver and tour guide throughout the day.

review.name: Saidur Rahman
review.review: Tour was lots of fun. We really enjoyed the tour to the River Meghna boat trip, walking over the village Raghunarchar and also loved life style of villagers. The village people are very poor but friendly. The day was good and well organized. We also enjoyed historical Goaldi Mosque, Panam Nagar, Sonargaon Museum. The guide Maksud was

review.name: Arman Salek
review.review: First of all I thank Mr. Kashem to arrange all Tourist Attractions in Sonargaon to fulfill all our needs and wishes with absolute excellence in the day we traveled with zero mistakes. The drivers and guides were all professional, on time and very helpful. All what we hear from the globe is absolutely untrue! See for yourself to find out the truth

title: Mahasthangarh and Paharpur
description: Explore the world heritage sites of Bangladesh named Mahasthangarh and Paharpur on this guided, full-day tour from Bogra. Travel through Govinda Bhita Hindu Temple, Gokul Medh- Behula Lakshindar Basor Ghor, Vasu Bihar and Somapura Mahavihara.

title: Rajshahi Highlights Day Tour
description: Enjoy a full-day tour in Rajshahi to visit some of the most amazing destinations including Bagha Mosque, the Puthia Temple Complex, Jagannath Temple, Dol Mandir, Govinda Temple, Royal Palace, Bara Ahnik Mandir and Natore Royal Palace.

title: Dhaka Mainamati
description: Book this full-day tour of Sonargaon and Mainamati to get to know the Banglar Tajmahal, The Folk Art Museum, Salban Vihara, Rupban Mura, Itakhola Mura, Mainamati Mound and Mainamati Museum.

title: Ratargul Swamp Forest
description: Start your day early in the morning as you meet your private tour guide in your hotel lobby. Departing from Sylhet, your journey begins with a leisurely drive by picturesque rice paddies fields. After arriving at Ratargul Swamp Forest, you will board a boat to explore one of the few freshwater swamp forests in the world. The forest is naturally conserved under the Department of Forestry (Govt. of Bangladesh). The evergreen forest is situated by the River Goain and linked with the Chengir Khal canal. Most of the trees that grow here are Koroch trees. The forest goes under 20-30 feet of water during the rainy season. For the rest of the year, the water level is about 10 feet deep variously.
